title: Digital Upgrades Shake Up July Prescription App Rankings
description: With CVS reporting stronger earnings last week, in large part based on its deployment of digital solutions, we took a look at the App Provider rankings
content:
With CVS reporting stronger earnings last week, in large part based on its deployment of digital solutions, we took a look at the App Provider rankings for prescription apps and found some surprises for July. The PYMNTS prescription app provider page offers a monthly ranking of prescription apps, assessing them based on publicly-available information and exclusive app-usage data, helping users identify the top performers in the market. The ranking aims to provide precise insights into app performance, aiding stakeholders in making informed decisions.

By completing this form, you agree to receive marketing communications from PYMNTS and to the sharing of your information with our sponsor, if applicable, in accordance with our Privacy Policy and Terms and Conditions .

The biggest surprise was that CVS did not post any gains along with its financial comeback, which it highlighted in earnings last week. But right up there was the performance of CenterWell Pharmacy, which posted an 11-point gain for a new score of 48. CenterWell is part of Humana’s suite of health services and benefits from integration with Humana’s Medicare Advantage and Part D plans. Humana’s continued commitment to expanding CenterWell facilities and the growing number of seniors choosing Medicare Advantage with CenterWell pharmacy benefits appear to reinforce strong membership and prescription volume growth. CenterWell Pharmacy recently launched a redesigned mobile app that streamlines prescription management with features such as real-time order tracking, simplified refills, easy prescription transfers and automatic refill options. The app, updated in late June 2025, has been met with positive user feedback and increased engagement, potentially improving medication adherence and satisfaction during July.

Also, posting a solid gain was RxSaver Prescription Discounts. It was up five points in July for a total score of 45. RxSaver continues to excel with its straightforward, no-membership-required coupon system, which lets consumers instantly compare medication prices at hundreds of pharmacies. Recent positive press, such as a mid-July 2025 Digital Journal review, highlighted RxSaver’s ease of use, transparency and wide acceptance, referring to it as a “reliable workhorse”—which may have boosted user trust and attracted new customers during the month. The March 2025 acquisition of RxSaver by GoodRx, a market leader, strengthened RxSaver’s consumer reach through combined technologies and brand recognition. This acquisition was followed by a 20% revenue growth report for GoodRx’s prescription savings products, suggesting a spillover of confidence and possible new user onboarding through cross-promotion.

Finally, OptumRx posted a 4-point gain, bringing its total score to 63. Effective July 1, OptumRx eliminated reauthorization requirements for more than 60 additional drugs used to treat chronic conditions, such as behavioral health, HIV, high cholesterol and hypertension. This move built upon previous eliminations and now covers more than 140 chronic disease medications in 2025, streamlining access for prescribers and patients and making the pharmacy experience less burdensome. By reducing administrative barriers, OptumRx improved patient medication access, supporting better adherence and health outcomes.
summary: The PYMNTS prescription app provider page has published its July rankings, which assesses prescription apps based on publicly-available information and app- usage data. The biggest surprise was the performance of CenterWell Pharmacy, which posted an 11-point gain for a new score of 48. CenterWell is part of Humana's suite of health services and benefits from integration with Humana’s Medicare Advantage and Part D plans. RxSaver Prescription Discounts also saw a significant gain, up five points in July for a total score of 45. OptumRx saw a 4-point increase, bringing its total score to 63. effective July 1, eliminating reauthorization requirements for more than 60 additional drugs used to treat chronic conditions.
shortSummary: Despite CVS' recent financial comeback, July's ranking of prescription apps revealed surprising gains, with CenterWell Pharmacy, RxSaver Prescription Discounts, and OptumRx also seeing significant gains.

Welcome to CenterWell Pharmacy

• 600+ licensed pharmacists available 24/7

| Your pharmacist
Refill or track your Rx without signing in
Refill up to 5 prescriptions without signing in. It’s easy and secure.
Check the progress of an order with just 1 step.
URGENT DRUG RECALL – Sucralfate 1gm Tablets
On 7/14/2025, the drug manufacturer, Nostrum Laboratories, Inc, announced a consumer level recall for its Sucralfate 1gm tablets. If you received Sucralfate 1gm tablets from CenterWell Pharmacy, please contact us by telephone at 855-544-9419, Monday – Friday, 8 a.m. – 11 p.m. and Saturday, 8 a.m. – 6:30 p.m., Eastern time.
Product notice – Dexcom G6 and G7 Receiver
If you recently ordered a Dexcom G6 or G7 Receiver from CenterWell Pharmacy, we want to let you know that Dexcom, the manufacturer of the Dexcom G6 and G7 Receivers, has issued a voluntary recall of certain lots and serial numbers of these blood sugar monitoring medical devices (Dexcom Recall Notice). Dexcom stated the speakers of the G6 and G7 Receivers may fail and not make an alert sound when blood sugar is low or high.
This issue is isolated to certain lots of the Dexcom G6 and G7 Receivers (see product details below) and does not affect other Dexcom products or diabetic monitoring supplies you may have received from CenterWell Pharmacy.
| Product Description | Unique Device Identifier (UDI)/Model | Lot/Serial Numbers |
|---|---|---|
| G6 Receiver | STK-FM-001 (MT27408-1) | 00386270003232 |
| G6 Receiver | STK-FR-001 (MT27408-1) | 00386270003225 |
| G7 Receiver | STK-AT-011 (MT26403-0) | 00386270002198 |
| G7 Receiver | STK-AT-012 (MT26403-0) | 00386270002518 |
| G7 Receiver | STK-AT-013 (MT26403-0) | 00386270002525 |
| G7 Receiver | STK-GT-001 (MT26403-1) | 00386270004291 |
| G7 Receiver | STK-GT-008 (MT26403-5) | 00386270004260 |
| G7 Receiver | STK-GT-013 (MT26403-1) | 00386270002273 |
| G7 Receiver | STK-GT-019 (MT26403-4) | 04595986293080 |
| G7 Receiver | STK-GT-100 (MT26403-2) | 00386270002020 |
| G7 Receiver | STK-GT-109 (MT26403-2) | 00386270002129 |
| G7 Receiver | STK-GT-113 (MT26403-3) | 00386270003638 |
What to do:
- Check the product list above to determine if your Dexcom G6 or G7 Receivers are recalled and affected. Dexcom’s website, www.dexcom.com/checkreceiver, can assist you.
- If your Dexcom G6 or G7 Receivers are recalled and affected, contact Dexcom directly at 1-844-478-1600 to receive a free replacement of Dexcom G6 or G7 Receivers. Dexcom is available 24 hours per day to assist you.
- Test your speaker regularly – Whether or not your Dexcom G6 or G7 Receivers are recalled and affected, test your receiver’s speaker every time you charge it. You can also re-test the sound at any time using the device menu. If the speaker does not beep when you test it, contact Dexcom right away. If the speaker beeps, be mindful that it may still fail without warning in the future.
- Make sure everyone who relies on the receiver for alerts (ex. patient, caregiver, etc.) knows about this possible problem.
If your Dexcom G6 or G7 Receivers are recalled and affected, continue to use your Dexcom products as directed by your healthcare provider, and immediately reach out to Dexcom for replacement product and further guidance.

Ready to get started?
You can count on us to deliver the medicines you need right to your door—on time, every time—and answer your questions along the way.

The skyrocketing cost of prescription drugs is a major pain point in the American budget. Out-of-pocket expenses can derail even the most carefully planned financial strategy. But before you overpay at the pharmacy counter again, you need to know about one of the most powerful money-saving tools available: prescription discount programs.
These services are free to use and leverage the power of group purchasing to negotiate lower prices on your behalf. We've analyzed the top contenders to determine which programs deliver the most value and the biggest savings. Here are the official rankings.
LowerMyRx Best Overall Value and Simplicity
GoodRx Best for Granular Price Comparisons
RxSaver Best for Straightforward Coupons
Blink Health Best for Predictable, Upfront Pricing
SingleCare Best for Bonus Member Savings
In-Depth Reviews of the Top Prescription Discount Cards
[Logo: LowerMyRx]
After a thorough review, LowerMyRx secures our top spot for its exceptional combination of top-tier discounts, a vast pharmacy network, and unparalleled ease of use. It strips away the complexity from healthcare savings, making it the most efficient and valuable tool for most consumers.
What We Love:
Maximum Savings, Minimum Effort: LowerMyRx delivers savings of up to 80% without requiring users to create an account or hand over personal data. It's the quickest path from search to savings.
Expansive Network: With acceptance at over 65,000 pharmacies--including CVS, Walgreens, and Walmart--your savings are accessible virtually anywhere.
Family and Pet-Friendly: A single card covers the entire household, and it even includes savings on many common pet medications, adding another layer of value.
The Verdict: For consumers who want the best possible price with the least amount of hassle, LowerMyRx is the clear winner. It focuses on providing maximum value and a frictionless experience, making it our number one recommendation.
GoodRx is a dominant force in this space, famous for its powerful search tool that lets users compare drug prices across multiple local pharmacies. This transparency ensures you get the lowest price possible.
What We Love:
Pharmacy Price Checker: Its signature feature is a real-time price comparison map, invaluable for savvy shoppers willing to go to the pharmacy with the best deal.
GoodRx Gold Membership: For a monthly fee, the Gold program can unlock even deeper discounts, offering a strong ROI for those with high-cost, recurring prescriptions.
The Verdict: GoodRx is the ultimate tool for meticulous savers. If you want to compare every local option to maximize your savings, its platform is a top-tier choice.
RxSaver operates on a simple and effective coupon-based model. It excels at providing easy-to-access coupons without requiring a complicated sign-up, getting you right to the discount.
What We Love:
Simple Coupon System: Search your medication, find the best coupon for a nearby pharmacy, and show it to the pharmacist. Its that direct.
No Membership Required: RxSaver is completely free, with no premium tiers or hidden fees to worry about.
The Verdict: RxSaver is a fantastic, no-fuss option for people who appreciate a direct and simple path to savings. Its a reliable workhorse in the world of prescription discounts.
Blink Health uses a unique model where you pay for your prescription online before going to the pharmacy. This locks in your price, guaranteeing that what you see online is what youll pay at the counter.
What We Love:
-- Price-Lock Guarantee: Paying upfront provides peace of mind and eliminates any risk of price changes at the pharmacy.
Home Delivery Option: Offers the convenience of mail-order prescriptions for many common medications.
The Verdict: For those who prioritize budget predictability and want to eliminate any surprises at the pharmacy counter, Blink Healths innovative pay-first model is an excellent solution.
SingleCare functions like a traditional discount card but adds a loyalty program to reward its users, making it a compelling choice for those with consistent medication needs.
What We Love:
Member Loyalty Program: Earn Bonus Savings on eligible prescriptions that you can apply to future purchases, effectively creating a compounding discount.
Broad Application: SingleCare also offers discounts on some dental and vision services.
The Verdict: If you consistently fill prescriptions and want your loyalty to be rewarded with extra savings, SingleCares unique loyalty program makes it a standout choice.
In todays economy, leaving money on the table is not an option. Overpaying for prescription drugs is an unnecessary leak in your budget, and choosing the right tool to plug that leak is a key financial decision.
While all the programs we reviewed offer a strong return in savings, LowerMyRx stands out as the best overall choice. Its powerful discounts, combined with a frictionless and efficient user experience, provide the maximum value for the modern consumer. Dont let high pharmacy prices impact your financial goals. Make the smart choice to start saving immediately.
The post Slash Your Pharmacy Bill: The Best Prescription Discount Programs appeared first on Insights News Wire.

The update builds on Optum Rx's recently announced commitment to eliminate certain reauthorizations to make prescription drugs more accessible and support better health outcomes. So far this year, Optum Rx has eliminated reauthorization requirements for more than 140 chronic disease medications.
“Chronic conditions affect about 60% of Americans and are the leading cause of death in the United States,” said Sumit Dutta, M.D., chief medical officer, Optum Rx. “Eliminating reauthorization requirements for established and effective treatments underscores our commitment to make these needed drugs more accessible, which also supports better health outcomes.”
Details
The newly added medications include treatments for seven chronic conditions, like behavioral health, HIV, dry eye disease, high cholesterol and hypertension.
Our independent Pharmacy & Therapeutics Committee, which is guided by a clinical-first mindset and deep health care expertise to evaluate drugs based on clinical rigor and evidence, identified these additional drugs for which reauthorizations would provide minimal value. This committee, composed of practicing physicians and pharmacists, conducts unbiased, evidence-based evaluations of new and existing medications.
What’s next
Optum Rx will continue to work with physicians and pharmacists to expand the list of eligible medications over time.
Since January 2025, Optum Rx has announced multiple actions aimed at transparently improving and modernizing pharmacy care, including:
100% pass-through of negotiated manufacturer rebates to clients
Reimbursement to pharmacies more aligned to their acquisition costs and reduction in drug reauthorization requirements
To learn more about Optum Rx’s efforts to improve transparency and make the health care system work better, please visit Optum Rx Transparency - UnitedHealth Group.
Share This Story

argos_summary: CVS's recent earnings report highlighted its digital solutions, yet it did not see gains in the prescription app rankings for July. CenterWell Pharmacy, part of Humana, made significant strides with an 11-point gain due to its redesigned mobile app, while RxSaver also improved its score by five points, benefiting from its straightforward coupon system and recent acquisition by GoodRx. OptumRx gained four points by eliminating reauthorization requirements for over 140 chronic medications, enhancing patient access and adherence.
